pages.1:
Docusign Envelope ID: 639276BB-CC5C-4E50-A049-CEF0913C3633
INCENTIVE UNIT GRANT AGREEMENT
UNDER THE FIREBIRD PARENT, L.P.
2024 EQUITY INCENTIVE PLAN
Name of Grantee: Aaron Treguboff (the “Grantee”)
No. of Units: 198,542.89 Class P Units (“Incentive Units”)
Grant Date: August 23, 2024 (the “Grant Date”)
Vesting Reference Date: July 18, 2024 (the “Vesting Reference Date”)
Participation Threshold: $353,406,342.30
Pursuant to the Firebird Parent, L.P. 2024 Equity Incentive Plan (the “Plan”), Firebird Parent, L.P.,
a Delaware limited partnership (together with all successors thereto, the “Company”), hereby grants to the
Grantee, who is an officer, employee, manager, consultant or other key person of the Company or any of
its Subsidiaries, the number of Incentive Units of the Company indicated above (the “Granted Units”),
subject to the terms and conditions set forth in this Incentive Unit Grant Agreement (this “Agreement”), in
the Plan and in the Company’s Second Amended and Restated Limited Partnership Agreement, dated as of
July 18, 2024 (as amended or modified from time to time pursuant to and in accordance with its terms, the
“Partnership Agreement”).
1. Definitions. All capitalized terms used herein and not otherwise defined shall have the
respective meanings set forth in the Partnership Agreement or the Plan, as applicable.
2. Vesting and Termination.
(a) Vesting.
(i) Time-Vesting. Subject to the determination of the Administrator in its sole
discretion to accelerate the vesting schedule hereunder, 50% of the Granted Units granted
hereunder (the “Time-Vesting Units”) shall vest as follows:
(A) 25% of the Time-Vesting Units shall vest upon the first
anniversary of the Vesting Reference Date, provided the Grantee has been in a continuous
Service Relationship (as defined below) through such date; and
(B) 75% of Time-Vesting Units shall vest in ratable installments
monthly thereafter over the following three years, provided the Grantee has been in a
continuous Service Relationship through each such date.
(ii) Performance-Vesting. Subject to the determination of the Administrator
in its sole discretion to accelerate the vesting schedule hereunder, 50% of the Granted Units granted
hereunder (the “Performance-Vesting Units”) shall vest upon a Change of Control if the following
MOIC hurdles are achieved as follows:
(A) Upon each of the Sponsor Partners receiving a 2.0x MOIC (as
defined below), 30% of the Performance-Vesting Units shall vest upon the consummation
of the Change of Control;
(B) Upon each of the Sponsor Partners receiving a 3.0x MOIC (as
A CTIVE/130697564.2
pages.2:
Docusign Envelope ID: 639276BB-CC5C-4E50-A049-CEF0913C3633
defined below), 40% of the Performance-Vesting Units shall vest upon the consummation
of the Change of Control; and
(C) Upon each of the Sponsor Partners receiving a 4.0x MOIC (as
defined below), 30% of the Performance-Vesting Units shall vest upon the consummation
of the Change of Control;
provided that, in each case of the forgoing clauses (A) through (C), the Grantee has been
in a continuous Service Relationship through the date such Change of Control.
By example: (i) if a Sponsor Partner receives less than a 2.0x MOIC, 0% of the
Performance-Vesting Units shall be vested upon the consummation of the Change of
Control; or (ii) if each Sponsor Partner receives at least a 2.0x MOIC but less than a 3.0x
MOIC, 30% of the total Performance-Vesting Units shall be vested upon the consummation
of the Change of Control; or (iii) if each Sponsor Partner receives at least a 3.0x MOIC
but less than a 4.0x MOIC, 70% of the total Performance-Vesting Units shall be vested
upon the consummation of the Change of Control; or (iv) if each Sponsor Partner receives
a 4.0x MOIC (or greater), 100% of the total Performance-Vesting Units shall be vested
upon the consummation of the Change of Control.
(D) In the event of a Change of Control, if any of the Sponsor Partners
does not receive at least a 2.0x MOIC, then no portion of the Performance-Vesting Units
shall vest and all of the Performance-Vesting Units shall be forfeited upon consummation
of such Change of Control. In the event of a Change of Control that results in all Sponsor
Partners receiving at least a 2.0x MOIC but less than a 3.0x MOIC and/or 4.0x MOIC, the
applicable remaining unvested portion of the Performance-Vesting Units, after giving
effect to Section 2(a)(ii)(A) and Section 2(a)(ii)(B) (if applicable), shall be forfeited upon
consummation of such Change of Control automatically, without any further action by any
Person, except as provided below. Notwithstanding the foregoing, in the event that the
proceeds in such Change of Control involve any contingent consideration amounts
deposited in escrow or any other contingent consideration (e.g., an earnout), and upon
resolution thereof additional Aggregate Proceeds are paid to the Sponsor Partners in respect
of Sponsor Partner Securities disposed of by the Sponsor Partners in such Change of
Control, the vesting of the Performance-Vesting Units shall be redetermined and, if
additional Performance-Vesting Units would vest as a result thereof, appropriate payments
in respect thereof shall be made by the Company or its successor to the Grantee as if any
Performance-Vesting Units that were unvested upon the closing of such Change of Control
would have vested had such additional Aggregate Proceeds been paid to the Sponsor
Partners upon the closing of such Change of Control.
(E) For purposes of this Section 2:
(1) “2.0x MOIC” means, with respect to any Sponsor Partner,
such Sponsor Partner receiving Aggregate Proceeds (as defined below) equal to
the product of (i) two (2), multiplied by (ii) such Sponsor Partner’s Aggregate
Investment (as defined below);
(2) “3.0x MOIC” means, with respect to any Sponsor Partner,
such Sponsor Partner receiving Aggregate Proceeds equal to the product of (i) three
(3), multiplied by (ii) such Sponsor Partner’s Aggregate Investment; and
2
A CTIVE/130697564.2
pages.3:
Docusign Envelope ID: 639276BB-CC5C-4E50-A049-CEF0913C3633
(3) “4.0x MOIC” means, with respect to any Sponsor Partner,
such Sponsor Partner receiving Aggregate Proceeds equal to the product of (i) four
(4), multiplied by (ii) such Sponsor Partner’s Aggregate Investment.
(4) “Aggregate Investment” means, with respect to a Sponsor
Partner, the aggregate amount of cash and/or the fair market value of any property
(as determined in good faith by the Board, it being understood that the Aggregate
Investment as of the date hereof: (i) with respect to the Mainsail Partners, is equal
to $170,147,714.87, and (ii) with respect to the JMI Partners, is equal to
$170,147,714.87) invested or otherwise contributed by such Sponsor Partner to the
Company from time to time in exchange for Partnership Interests or other equity
securities of the Company, on or following July 18, 2024; provided, however,
notwithstanding anything to the contrary, in the event that following the date
hereof, a Sponsor Partner acquires any Partnership Units held by another Limited
Partner, the amount paid by such Sponsor Partner to acquire such Partnership Units
shall not be deemed to increase such Sponsor Partner’s Aggregate Investment
(provided, that for the avoidance of doubt, if the selling Limited Partner in such
transfer is a Sponsor Partner, such transferring Sponsor Partner’s Aggregate
Investment shall not be decreased by any amount in respect of such transferred
Partnership Units).
(5) “Aggregate Proceeds” means, with respect to a Sponsor
Partner, the aggregate amount of (i) cash received by such Sponsor Partner (x)
from the Company pursuant to Distributions made in respect of Sponsor Partner
Securities (as defined below) or (y) from any Third Party Buyer or any
Continuation Fund of such Sponsor Partner as consideration for Sponsor Partner
Securities disposed of by such Sponsor Partner and (ii) the fair market value of any
direct or indirect Partnership Units or other equity securities of the Company
retained by such Sponsor Partner in a Change of Control, in each case, to the extent
received or retained on or following July 18, 2024 and calculated after giving effect
to the acceleration or vesting of, and payments in respect of, any equity, equity-
based or transaction-related arrangements of the Company and any of its Affiliates.
(6) “Service Relationship” means any relationship as an
employee, part-time employee, director or other key person (including consultants)
of the Company or any Subsidiary or any successor entity such that, for example,
a Service Relationship shall be deemed to continue without interruption in the
event the Grantee’s status changes from full-time employee to part-time employee
or consultant or if Grantee transfers employment or service from the Company or
a Subsidiary to another Subsidiary or the Company.
(7) “Sponsor Partner Securities” means, with respect to any
Sponsor Partner, the Partnership Interests or other equity securities of the
Company held by such Sponsor Partner.
(F) Notwithstanding the foregoing, if a 2.0x MOIC, a 3.0x MOIC or
a 4.0x MOIC, as applicable, would be received by the Sponsor Partners, but after taking
into account the dilutive effect of the corresponding vesting of other Class P Units, a 2.0x
MOIC, a 3.0x MOIC or a 4.0x MOIC is no longer received, then the Grantee will become
vested in the maximum number of Performance-Vesting Units as would permit such 2.0x,
MOIC, 3.0x MOIC or 4.0x MOIC, as applicable, to still be received by the Sponsor
3
A CTIVE/130697564.2
pages.4:
Docusign Envelope ID: 639276BB-CC5C-4E50-A049-CEF0913C3633
Partners, such amount to be determined by the Administrator in its reasonable and good
faith discretion.
(b) Treatment of Units After Termination; Repurchase Event.
(i) Upon any Termination, except as otherwise may be determined by the
Administrator, all Granted Units that are unvested as of the date of such Termination shall
immediately be forfeited and terminated as of such Termination and shall no longer be outstanding
as of the date of such Termination. Notwithstanding the terms herein or in the Plan, all of the
Granted Units shall be immediately discontinued and forfeited for no consideration, and the
Company shall have no further obligation hereunder to the Grantee, if the Grantee experiences a
Termination for Cause or if the Company reasonably and in good faith determines, no later than
six (6) months following such Termination (or, if earlier, immediately prior to a Change of
Control), that grounds for Cause existed upon such Termination or a Covenant Breach Triggering
Event occurs. The Administrator shall apply the provisions of this Section 2(b)(i) in its sole
reasonable and good faith discretion, and such exercise of discretion shall be conclusive and
binding upon the Grantee and all other persons.
(ii) All Granted Units shall be subject to the terms of the Partnership
Agreement, including the Company’s rights of repurchase set forth in Section 9.6 of the Partnership
Agreement.
3. Incorporation of Plan and Partnership Agreement; Joinder. Notwithstanding anything
herein to the contrary, the Granted Units shall be subject to and governed by all the terms and conditions
of the Plan and the Partnership Agreement, including without limitation the provisions with respect to
repurchase and transfer of Incentive Units as set forth in the Partnership Agreement including Exhibits
attached thereto; provided that in the event of any conflict between the terms of the Plan and this Agreement,
this Agreement shall control. By executing this Agreement, the Grantee hereby becomes a party the
Partnership Agreement as a Partner, a Management Partner (if applicable) and a holder of Class P Units
and agrees to execute a joinder to the Partnership Agreement, substantially in the form attached as Exhibit
A hereto (provided that the Grantee shall be bound by the Partnership Agreement whether or not such
joinder is actually executed).
4. Withholding Taxes. The Grantee agrees that the Company or any of its subsidiaries have
the right to deduct from payments of any kind otherwise due to the Grantee, all federal, foreign, state or
local taxes of any kind required by law to be withheld with respect to the grant of the Granted Units to the
Grantee. The Grantee agrees to elect, in accordance with Section 83(b) of the Code and the form election
provided as Exhibit B hereto, to recognize ordinary income in the year of acquisition of the Granted Units,
and to pay to the Company all withholding taxes based on the excess, if any, of the aggregate fair market
value of such Granted Units (determined without regard to any restriction other than any restriction that by
its terms will never lapse) as of the date hereof over the amount, if any, paid for such Granted Units.
5. Restrictions on Transfer of Granted Units. None of the Granted Units shall be
Transferred prior to vesting and otherwise shall not be Transferred unless such Transfer is in compliance
with all applicable securities laws (including, without limitation, the Securities Act), and such disposition
is in accordance with the terms and conditions, and subject to the restrictions, of the Partnership Agreement
and such disposition does not cause the Company to become subject to the reporting requirements of the
Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended.
6. Investment Representations.
4
A CTIVE/130697564.2
pages.5:
Docusign Envelope ID: 639276BB-CC5C-4E50-A049-CEF0913C3633
(a) The Grantee is acquiring the Granted Units for the Grantee’s own account for
investment only, and not for resale or with a view to the distribution thereof. The Grantee has had such an
opportunity as he or she has deemed adequate to obtain from the Company such information as is necessary
to permit him or her to evaluate the merits and risks of the Grantee’s investment in the Company and has
consulted with the Grantee’s own advisers with respect to the Grantee’s investment in the Company. The
Grantee has sufficient experience in business, financial and investment matters to be able to evaluate the
risks involved in the acquisition of the Granted Units and to make an informed investment decision with
respect to such acquisition. The Grantee can afford a complete loss of the value of the Granted Units and
is able to bear the economic risk of holding such Granted Units for an indefinite period.
(b) The Grantee understands that the Granted Units are not registered under the
Securities Act of 1933, as amended (it being understood that the Granted Units are being issued and sold
in reliance on the exemption provided in Rule 701 thereunder) or any applicable state securities or “blue
sky” laws and may not be sold or otherwise transferred or disposed of in the absence of an effective
registration statement under the Securities Act and under any applicable state securities or “blue sky” laws
(or exemptions from the registration requirements thereof). The Grantee further acknowledges that
certificates representing the Granted Units will bear restrictive legends reflecting the foregoing and/or that
book entries for uncertificated Granted Units will include similar restrictive notations.
7. Miscellaneous Provisions.
(a) No Employment Rights. No provision of this Agreement shall (a) confer upon the
Grantee any right to be or continue, as the case may be, in the employ or service of the Company or any
Subsidiary, (b) affect the right of the Company or any Subsidiary to terminate the Service Relationship of
the Grantee, with or without Cause, or (c) confer upon the Grantee any right to participate in any employee
welfare or benefit plan or other program of the Company or any Subsidiary, other than the Plan. The
Grantee hereby acknowledges and agrees that the Company or any Subsidiary may terminate the
Grantee’s employment or other Service Relationship at any time, with or without notice, and for any
reason, or for no reason.
(b) Equitable Relief. The parties hereto agree and declare that legal remedies may be
inadequate to enforce the provisions of this Agreement and that equitable relief, including specific
performance and injunctive relief, may be used to enforce the provisions of this Agreement.
(c) Adjustments for Changes in Capital Structure. If, as a result of any reorganization,
recapitalization, reclassification, unit dividend, unit split, reverse unit split or other similar change in the
Class P Units, the outstanding Class P Units are increased or decreased or are exchanged for a different
number or kind of Units of the Company, the restrictions and obligations contained in this Agreement and
the Partnership Agreement shall apply with equal force to additional and/or substitute securities, if any,
received by the Grantee in exchange for, or by virtue of his or her ownership of, Granted Units.
(d) Change and Modifications. This Agreement may not be orally changed, modified
or terminated, nor shall any oral waiver of any of its terms be effective. This Agreement may be changed,
modified or terminated by the Company; provided, however, that any changes or amendments that are
materially adverse to the Grantee’s Granted Units issued hereunder may only be implemented by an
agreement in writing signed by the Company and the Grantee or as otherwise set forth in the Partnership
Agreement; provided, that to the extent the Administrator amends this Agreement in a manner that has a
materially adverse effect on the Grantee without the Grantee’s consent, the Grantee shall continue to be
bound and governed by the terms of this Agreement as in effect prior to such amendment. Notwithstanding
anything to the contrary in the foregoing, the Administrator may amend any term of the Plan that is
5
A CTIVE/130697564.2
pages.6:
Docusign Envelope ID: 639276BB-CC5C-4E50-A049-CEF0913C3633
applicable to all grantees with the prior written approval of a majority of such grantees (based on the number
of Class P Units held by all such grantees).
(e) Governing Law. This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in
accordance with the Delaware Revised Uniform Limited Partnership Act as to matters within the scope
thereof, and as to all other matters shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the internal laws
of Delaware, without regard to conflict of law principles that would result in the application of any law
other than the law of the State of Delaware.
(f) Headings; Construction. The headings are intended only for convenience in
finding the subject matter and do not constitute part of the text of this Agreement and shall not be considered
in the interpretation of this Agreement. Unless otherwise indicated, any “Section” reference herein is a
reference to a section of this Agreement.
(g) Saving Clause. If any provision(s) of this Agreement shall be determined to be
illegal or unenforceable, such determination shall in no manner affect the legality or enforceability of any
other provision hereof.
(h) Notices. All notices, requests, consents and other communications shall be in
writing and be deemed given when delivered personally, by telex or facsimile transmission or when
received if mailed by first class registered or certified mail, postage prepaid. Notices to the Company or
the Grantee shall be addressed as set forth underneath their signatures below, or to such other address or
addresses as may have been furnished by such party in writing to the other.
(i) Severability. Whenever possible, each provision of this Agreement shall be
interpreted in a manner as to be effective and valid under applicable law, but if any provision of this
Agreement or the application of any such provision to any Person or circumstance shall be held to be
prohibited by or illegal or unenforceable under applicable law in any respect by a court of competent
jurisdiction, such provision shall be ineffective only in such jurisdiction and to the extent of such
prohibition, illegality or unenforceability, without invalidating the remainder of such provision or the
remaining provisions of this Agreement in such jurisdiction or any provisions of this Agreement in any
other jurisdiction.
(j) Benefit and Binding Effect. This Agreement shall be binding upon and shall inure
to the benefit of the parties hereto, their respective successors, permitted assigns, and legal representatives.
The Company has the right to assign this Agreement, and such assignee shall become entitled to all the
rights of the Company hereunder to the extent of such assignment.
(k) Counterparts. For the convenience of the parties and to facilitate execution, this
Agreement may be executed in two or more counterparts (including by facsimile or other electronic
transmission), each of which shall be deemed an original, but all of which shall constitute one and the same
document.
[SIGNATURE PAGE FOLLOWS]
6

EXHIBIT A
JOINDER TO
SECOND AMENDED AND RESTATED LIMITED PARTNERSHIP AGREEMENT
THIS JOINDER TO THE SECOND AMENDED AND RESTATED LIMITED PARTNERSHIP
AGREEMENT (this “Joinder”) is dated as of August 23, 2024 between Firebird Parent, L.P., a Delaware
limited partnership (the “Company”), and the undersigned Person (the “New Partner”).
The Company has entered into the Second Amended and Restated Limited Partnership Agreement
of the Company, dated as of July 18, 2024, among the Company and its Partners (as amended or restated
from time to time, the “LP Agreement”). Pursuant to the terms of the LP Agreement, the New Partner is
required to execute this Joinder for the purposes of making the New Partner a party to the LP Agreement.
The New Partner has agreed to execute this Joinder in consideration of the receipt of the New Partner’s
Partnership Interest.
NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants contained in this Joinder and other
good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are acknowledged, the parties to this
Joinder agree as follows:
1. DEFINED TERMS. All capitalized, undefined terms used in this Joinder have the
meanings assigned thereto in the LP Agreement.
2. JOINDER; AGREEMENT TO BE BOUND. The New Partner hereby agrees to become a
party to the LP Agreement with all right, title and interest as a Limited Partner thereunder and
subject to all of the terms and conditions thereof. The New Partner’s legal name and notice address
for purposes of the Partnership Ledger of the LP Agreement is:
Name
Aaron Treguboff
Address 7423 W Abraham Ln
__________________________
________G_l_e_n_d_a_l_e_,_ _A_Z_ _8_5_3_0_8_
__________________________
3. GOVERNING LAW. Delaware law, without regard to any principle of choice of law that
would permit or require the application of the laws of any other jurisdiction, exclusively governs
this Joinder.
4. COUNTERPARTS. The parties to this Joinder may execute it in multiple counterparts
with the same effect as if all signing parties had signed the same document. All counterparts will
be construed together and constitute the same instrument. Further, this Joinder may be executed
by transfer of an originally signed document by facsimile, e-mail in PDF format or other electronic
means, any of which will be as fully binding as an original document.
5. DESCRIPTIVE HEADINGS. The descriptive headings of this Joinder are inserted only
for convenience and do not constitute a part of this Joinder.
A CTIVE/130697626.2

EXHIBIT B
Section 83(b) Election
The undersigned hereby elects pursuant to §83(b) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as
amended, to include in gross income as compensation for services the excess (if any) of the fair market
value of the shares described below over the amount paid for those shares.
1. The name, taxpayer identification number, address of the undersigned, and the taxable year for
which this election is being made are:
Taxpayer’s Name:
Taxpayer’s Social Security Number:
Address:
Taxable Year: Calendar Year 2024
2. The property which is the subject of this election is _____________ Class P Units (the “Units”) of
Firebird Parent, L.P. (the “Company”)
3. The property was transferred to the undersigned on _______________ ___, 2024.
4. The property is subject to the following restrictions:
The Units will be subject to restrictions on transfer and risk of forfeiture upon termination of service
relationship and, in the case of fifty percent (50%) of the Units, failure to achieve certain
performance-based vesting conditions based on the achievement of certain return multiples on
money invested int the Company. Under certain circumstances, the Company also has the right to
repurchase the Units less than fair market value.
5. The fair market value of the property at time of transfer (determined without regard to any
restrictions other than nonlapse restrictions as defined in §1.83-3(h) of the Income Tax Regulations)
is $0.
6. For the property transferred, the undersigned paid $0.
7. The amount to include in gross income is $0.
The undersigned taxpayer will file this election with the Internal Revenue Service Office with which the
taxpayer files his or her annual income tax return not later than 30 days after the date of transfer of the
property. A copy of the election will also be furnished to the person for whom the services were performed.
The undersigned is the person performing services in connection with which the property was transferred.
Dated: __________________, 2024
Taxpayer
(Signature Page to Joinder to Second Amended and Restated Limited Partnership Agreement of
Firebird Parent, L.P.)
